intro: Gouania tiliifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its alternate, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruit is a three-lobed capsule. Gouania tiliifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
